thread.title: Joshua Jackson not hopeful about a Dawson's Creek reunion: 'One of the main characters is dead' - TV
thread.title_full: Joshua Jackson not hopeful about a Dawson's Creek reunion: 'One of the main characters is dead' - TV News - Digital Spy

author: Tasha Hegarty
title: Joshua Jackson not hopeful about a Dawson's Creek reunion: 'One of the main characters is dead' - TV
text: Joshua Jackson has broken our teen hearts all over again by saying he doesn't think there will ever be a Dawson's Creek reunion series.He told The Wrap it would be too difficult to do because one of the main characters - Michelle Williams's Jen Lindley - was killed off at the end. © PA Images / Evan Agostini/AP Dawson's Creek: James Van Der Beek, Katie Holmes, Michelle Williams - Where are they now?Jackson said: "Well, they killed off one of the main characters - you can't do a revival series, one of us is dead! She's a ghost? She comes back as a ghost?"I think at this point, so much time has passed, I think it's probably time to let that go for the next generation."However, it seems former cast mate Katie Holmes thinks something could be arranged. © Columbia/TriStar International Television "There's been a lot of talk about it," she said earlier this year. "And I don't know, because when we did our finale, it was set five years later, so we kind of did that."And Michelle's character passed away in the last episode, so... yeah, you never know. Get Jimmy Fallon on the phone, pronto!"The series ran from 1998-2003 and also starred James Van Der Beek, Kerr Smith and Meredith Monroe.Jackson is currently appearing in The Affair, which premieres its second season on October 4 on Showtime.
